name: Æther Tide
text:
As an additional cost to cast Æther Tide, discard X creature cards.
Return X target creatures to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: The tide of magic brought them here. Now it would take them home.

name: Allay
text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target enchantment.

name: Anarchist
text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: "I'll take that. You won't need it when the revolution comes."
Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.
Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.
"I'll take that. You won't need it when the revolution comes."

name: Angelic Blessing
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

editions.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
The man who rose up to fight was not the same man knocked down.
Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

name: Avenging Druid
text: Whenever Avenging Druid deals damage to an opponent, you may reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a land card. If you do, put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

name: Bequeathal
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, you draw two cards.

editions.flavor:
"On my death, I give you this treasure: the knowledge that life is hard, yet too soon past."
—Dal funeral rite

name: Carnophage
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.

editions.flavor: Eating is all it knows.

"And in their blind and unattaining state their miserable lives have sunk so low that they must envy every other fate."
—Dante, Inferno, trans. Ciardi
Eating is all it knows.
Eating is all it knows.

name: Cartographer
text: When Cartographer enters the battlefield, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: How do you map a world when the land moves beneath your feet?
"Finding the way once is luck. Finding the way twice takes a good map."

name: Cataclysm
text: Each player chooses from among the permanents he or she controls an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, then sacrifices the rest.

editions.flavor:
"Keep with you only this much: your mount, your blade, and your wits. The rest you can find, build, or take."
—Horse clans' wisdom
The Weatherlight dragged the Predator behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.
The Weatherlight dragged the Predator behind it, the cradle hauling the casket.

name: Cat Burglar
text: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: The il-Kor no longer roam the open plains, but they are still hunters.

name: Charging Paladin
text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."
"Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."
A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.

"Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."

name: Cinder Crawler
text: {R}: Cinder Crawler gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if Cinder Crawler is blocked.

editions.flavor: The crawler doesn't care what gets in its way. It pushes everything into the boiling muck and waits for the meal to cook.

name: City of Traitors
text:
When you play another land, sacrifice City of Traitors.
{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"While we fought, the il surrendered."
—Oracle en-Vec

"While we fought, the il surrendered."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Coat of Arms
text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

editions.flavor: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.

"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march

Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march

"Hup, two, three, four,

name: Convalescence
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 10 or less life, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Selenia had hurt Mirri terribly, but injuries of the flesh could be treated. The wounds she had torn in Crovax's soul would never close.

name: Crashing Boars
text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature he or she controls. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.

editions.flavor: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.

name: Culling the Weak
text:
As an additional cost to cast Culling the Weak, sacrifice a creature.
Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"The blood of the weak shall be the ink with which we scribe great Yawgmoth's glorious name."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Cunning
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature attacks or blocks, sacrifice Cunning at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

editions.flavor:
". . . Dry-walkers die
We feed on sweet flesh . . . ."
—Rootwater Saga

name: Curiosity
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.
All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.
"You know that secret? The one that wakes you up at night in a cold sweat? The one you think no one else in the world knows? Well, guess what."
"Surely you know the joy of the hunt, my furry friend. My kind of hunt just takes a different form than yours."

name: Cursed Flesh
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: Misery, filth, disease—all things that bring suffering to the world—only make Phyrexians more dangerous.
A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . . .
A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . .

name: Dauthi Cutthroat
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with shadow.

editions.flavor: In their twisted logic, to empty the shadow world is to escape it.

name: Dauthi Jackal
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{B}{B}, Sacrifice Dauthi Jackal: Destroy target blocking creature.

editions.flavor:
"All Dauthi are jackals, regardless of breed."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary

"All dauthi are jackals, regardless of breed."
—Lyna, soltari emissary

name: Dauthi Warlord
text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Dauthi Warlord's power is equal to the number of creatures with shadow on the battlefield.

name: Death's Duet
text: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.
Life has always been a dance. It is only fitting that death sing the tune.

name: Dizzying Gaze
text:
Enchant creature you control
{R}: Enchanted creature deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"When I cut down my angel I only started my fall."
—Crovax

name: Dominating Licid
text:
{1}{U}{U}, {T}: Dominating Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.
You control enchanted creature.

name: Elven Palisade
text: Sacrifice a Forest: Target attacking creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Volrath is not the only one who can shape this world to serve him."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Elvish Berserker
text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

editions.flavor: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.
Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.
Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.

name: Entropic Specter
text:
Flying
As Entropic Specter enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Entropic Specter's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in the chosen player's hand.
Whenever Entropic Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

name: Ephemeron
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Return Ephemeron to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: From nothing came teeth.
From nothing came teeth.
From nothing came teeth.

name: Equilibrium
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: In Rath, there are only so many souls to go around.

Seek balance in all things—as long as the scales are weighted in your favor.
—Vodalian saying

name: Erratic Portal
text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"
"In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"

name: Ertai, Wizard Adept
text: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell.

editions.flavor:
"Was that it?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Exalted Dragon
text:
Flying
Exalted Dragon can't attack unless you sacrifice a land. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

editions.flavor: If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.
If dragons excel at anything more than vanity, it is greed.

name: Fade Away
text: For each creature, its controller sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

editions.flavor:
"Consider the fable of the greedy herder. As her flock grew, so did her weariness; she slept, and the sheep wandered off."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Fighting Chance
text: For each blocking creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by that creature this turn.

editions.flavor: A stroke of luck can smite an army.

name: Flowstone Flood
text:
Buyback—Pay 3 life, Discard a card at random. (You may pay 3 life and discard a card at random in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Destroy target land.

name: Forbid
text:
Buyback—Discard two cards. (You may discard two cards in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Counter target spell.

name: Fugue
text: Target player discards three cards.

editions.flavor: "My ship . . . ," Sisay mumbled. "Intact," Gerrard reassured her, "which is more than I can say for you, my friend." Sisay laughed despite the pain.

"It's hard to keep our own troops from fleeing when he's like this. How can our foes possibly stand against him?"
—Field marshal for the Eastern Paladin

name: Furnace Brood
text: {R}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

editions.flavor: Furnace air crackles with magmatic cackles.
Furnace air crackles with magmatic cackles.

name: Grollub
text: Whenever Grollub is dealt damage, each opponent gains that much life.

editions.flavor: Mogglings caught in a misdeed often blame the grollub. Even though the creature is usually innocent, no taskmaster can resist an excuse to beat it.

name: Hatred
text:
As an additional cost to cast Hatred, pay X life.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I will flay the skin from your flesh and the flesh from your bones and scrape your bones dry. And still you will not have suffered enough."
—Greven il-Vec, to Gerrard

name: High Ground
text: Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.

editions.flavor: In war, as in society, position is everything.
In war, as in society, position is everything.

name: Jackalope Herd
text: When you cast a spell, return Jackalope Herd to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: There's little more demeaning than getting your butt kicked by a bunch of bunnies.

name: Keeper of the Beasts
text: {G}, {T}: Choose target opponent who controlled more creatures than you did as you activated this ability. Put a 2/2 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

name: Keeper of the Dead
text: {B}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had at least two fewer creature cards in his or her graveyard than you did as you activated this ability. Destroy target nonblack creature he or she controls.

name: Keeper of the Flame
text: {R}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had more life than you did as you activated this ability. Keeper of the Flame deals 2 damage to him or her.

name: Keeper of the Light
text: {W}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had more life than you did as you activated this ability. You gain 3 life.

name: Keeper of the Mind
text: {U}, {T}: Choose target opponent who had at least two more cards in hand than you did as you activated this ability. Draw a card.

name: Killer Whale
text: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.
Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.
Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.
Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.

name: Kor Chant
text: All damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control by a source of your choice is dealt to another target creature instead.

editions.flavor: The true treasure no thief can touch.
Sacred rites repurposed to fight an ancient threat.
The true treasure no thief can touch.

name: Limited Resources
text:
When Limited Resources enters the battlefield, each player chooses five lands he or she controls and sacrifices the rest.
Players can't play lands as long as ten or more lands are on the battlefield.

name: Mage il-Vec
text: {T}, Discard a card at random: Mage il-Vec deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the il.
Living below a flowstone foundry produces a disproportionate number of fire mages among the il.

name: Manabond
text: At the beginning of your end step, you may reveal your hand and put all land cards from it onto the battlefield. If you do, discard your hand.

name: Mana Breach
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The wizard had it all—until she tried to use it.
The mana that binds the world together can also tear it apart.

name: Maniacal Rage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.

editions.flavor: "Remember me?" Tahngarth roared. "Now I'll repay you for my stay on Rath"
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
The spikes of sangrite made the goblin stronger, but they didn't make him any smarter.

name: Medicine Bag
text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor:
"My medicine bag and I have treated countless wounds and illnesses. But never have I seen so many made so sick for so long. We will never eat Squee's cooking again."
—Orim, journal

name: Memory Crystal
text: Buyback costs cost {2} less.

editions.flavor: Hues of recollection flicker like facets of a gem.

name: Merfolk Looter
text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.
In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.
When you sink a lot of ships, it's easy to find sunken treasure.
In the depths of Rootwater, salvage and sewage differ only in texture.
Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.

It belongs to the merfolk now.
—Shipwreck prayer

name: Mindless Automaton
text:
Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.

name: Mind Maggots
text: When Mind Maggots enters the battlefield, discard any number of creature cards. For each card discarded this way, put two +1/+1 counters on Mind Maggots.

name: Mind Over Matter
text: Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor:
Lyna turned to the figure beside her. "They're gone. What now?"
"As ever," said Urza, "we wait."

name: Mirozel
text:
Flying
When Mirozel becomes the target of a spell or ability, return Mirozel to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The mirozels are the only stars in Rath's opaque skies.

name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

editions.flavor:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary

name: Mogg Assassin
text: {T}: You choose target creature an opponent controls, and that opponent chooses target creature. Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy the creature you chose. If you lose the flip, destroy the creature your opponent chose.

name: Monstrous Hound
text:
Monstrous Hound can't attack unless you control more lands than defending player.
Monstrous Hound can't block unless you control more lands than attacking player.

editions.flavor: "Stay."
"Stay."

name: Nausea
text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Any mogg will tell you there's nothing more nauseating than the smell of cute.
No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.
No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

name: Necrologia
text:
Cast Necrologia only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast Necrologia, pay X life.
Draw X cards.

editions.flavor:
"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath

"My enemies' death yields threefold benefit: removal, reuse, and research."
—Volrath

name: Null Brooch
text: {2}, {T}, Discard your hand: Counter target noncreature spell.

editions.flavor:
Give away everything so others have nothing.
—Brooch inscription

name: Oath of Druids
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who controls more creatures than he or she does and is his or her opponent. The first player may reveal cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. If he or she does, that player puts that card onto the battlefield and all other cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard.

name: Oath of Ghouls
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player whose graveyard has fewer creature cards in it than his or her graveyard does and is his or her opponent. The first player may return a creature card from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.

name: Oath of Lieges
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who controls more lands than he or she does and is his or her opponent. The first player may search his or her library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.

name: Oath of Mages
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who has more life than he or she does and is his or her opponent. The first player may have Oath of Mages deal 1 damage to the second player.

name: Oath of Scholars
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses target player who has more cards in hand than he or she does and is his or her opponent. The first player may discard his or her hand and draw three cards.

name: Ogre Shaman
text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Ogre Shaman deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.
Ogre shamans must be bright enough to learn their invocations and dim enough to use them.

name: Onslaught
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, tap target creature.

editions.flavor: The last thing to go through the mogg's mind was its teeth.

name: Paladin en-Vec
text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

editions.flavor: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."
"Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."

name: Pandemonium
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player of his or her choice.

"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player reveals the top card of his or her library. If that card is a land card, destroy that creature. Otherwise, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

text: {W}, Discard a card: You gain 3 life.

One back—dwell with tribe and tent,
